title: Quiz 4: Roles & Functions of Community Health Nurse
description: Test your ability to identify and describe the various roles and functions of a community health nurse.

questions.question: Match the nurse's role with the correct function:

pairs.right: Organizing and leading health care programs
Carrying out surveys to identify problems

questions.explanation: Manager=Leader; Advocator=Voice for community; Educator=Teacher; Researcher=Investigator.
questions.hint: Link the job title to the action.

questions.question: Which role involves sharing technical health information with individual families and communities?
questions.explanation: The Advisor role specifically involves sharing technical advice/information.
questions.hint: Someone who gives counsel or advice.

questions.question: As an ___BLANK___, the nurse identifies existing and potential health needs and resources in the community.
questions.explanation: The Assessor/Identifier role involves evaluating the status and needs of the community.
questions.hint: A role that involves checking or evaluating status.

questions.question: Which functions fall under the 'Implementer' role? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Developing community ability to assess needs

questions.explanation: Research is a Researcher role. Implementer involves putting plans into action and building capacity.

questions.question: The 'Evaluator' role is responsible for training other community health workers.
questions.explanation: Training is the function of the **Trainer** role. The Evaluator assesses outcomes and performance.

questions.question: What is the term for the broad areas of responsibility assumed by a nurse (e.g., the job they perform)?
questions.explanation: Function refers to the job or activities a nurse is expected to perform.

questions.question: When a nurse plans for health action with other team members, they are acting in the role of:
questions.explanation: The Planner role involves designing the course of action.
questions.hint: The name of the role is in the question.

questions.question: Arrange the logic flow of a nurse's intervention roles:
questions.explanation: The nursing process flow: Assess -> Plan -> Implement -> Evaluate.

questions.question: The role of a community health nurse is strictly limited to hospital duties.
questions.explanation: The role extends to the community to prevent illness and maximize health, not just hospital duties.
questions.hint: Where does a 'community' health nurse work?

questions.question: Who does the 'Trainer' role focus on teaching?
questions.explanation: The Trainer role specifically involves training other health workers and volunteers (CORPs).
